title: C#: 3 manuscripts - Access Deep Web Activity FAST! (Set up Tor 2016) + Create Your Own Pen Testing Lab + Ultimate Hacking Coursebook for beginners (computer ... hacking, programming, security networks)
summary: ... always wanted to learn how to create a very good security network and I was lucky enough to find ...
review: I always wanted to learn how to create a very good security network and I was lucky enough to find this book and learn some useful tips from it. At first I thought I will be confuse in the procedures and guidelines in this book but I was wrong, the author manage to explain everything you need to know about security network.

title: The Computer and the Brain
review: While the metaphor of brain as computer (or computer is brain) is highly misleading , von Neumann's book is an illuminating mid-century perspective on the relation between the two. von Neumann writes with a clarity that is often missing in the individual fields he straddles here - even now his book would serve as an introduction to both computer science and neuroscience for the general reader.

title: The Computer and the Brain
summary: Interesting view of what the early days' thought processes of neuroscience and computer science
review:
I got this book after seeing Jacob Bronowski mention it on his 'Ascent of Man' series. It certainly may seem dated in some parts now, but some of the fundamentals it goes over are timeless.

I think it would be better to start reading this book while thinking of from an historical perspective instead of expecting current scientific schools of thought.

title: CyberWar Vengeance
summary: Thoroughly enjoyed this fast-paced, military fiction, employing weapons very probably in R&D or already fielded for specops.
review: I was quite impressed with this T.B. Giboney military-specops fiction (maybe) book; it was an exciting read. I really hated to put it down, and only did when I had to. I enjoyed the story and action, with realistic and believable high-tech and SpecOps, start to finish. I found myself continually "analyzing" the physics of the "EMP" aspects (weapons, towers, and dead zones) in the near future setting, with no obvious flaws. He had an interesting mix of active duty & retired military, U.S. Military Academy, and Special Operations/Special Forces players. I thoroughly enjoyed and highly recommend CyberWar Vengeance to anyone who enjoys "Tom Clancy" type near future military/specops fiction.

title: CyberWar Vengeance
summary: Timely topic and first rate page turner
review:
The special operations training and missions have a "been there done that" feel. The science seems plausible and the politics and issues raised couldn't be more timely. The writer knows how to keep things moving briskly along while keeping the reader involved.

Not exactly a cliffhanger ending but it definitely sets up a Book Two. Looking forward to that, hopes it gets here soon.

title: CyberWar Vengeance
review:
If you like Vince Flynn, Brad Thor, Robert Ludlum, John Grisham or any of that ilk, you will LOVE this book! It starts out fast and gets faster, very hard to put down. Giboney's writing is superb. On par with the earlier mentioned authors. Character development and story line development flawless.

What makes it fascinating is the absolute believability of the scenario. Totally plausible in today's environment just a shade into the future.

I hope they make this into a movie - it would be a hit.

title: CyberWar Vengeance
review: This is an interesting journey into the possibilities of cyber warfare. It also demonstrates that all warfare is eventually settled in the only way possible: boots on the ground.

title: Windows 10: The Beginner's Guide on how to enjoy and make the most of Windows 10
review: I have not upgraded since Windows Vista. With the exception of two or three really new things I found this book to be almost vacuous.I found I was not as far behind as I had thought. The descriptions were given in a vague manner. I never felt overwhelmed because there was so little specific and nothing even slightly negative. It described Windows 10 about as well as the Chamber of Commerce covers New York City. You know; it has lots of tall buildings, and culture, and its really great! I was only able to get some good from it by sitting down at the computer and wrestling with the actual operating system as I tried to decipher the meaning of the text I was reading. It was worth the $0.99 I paid for it as Kindle reader. I will have to search more extensively - and more expensively to find a more thorough GUIDE!

title: Windows 10: The Beginner's Guide on how to enjoy and make the most of Windows 10
review: I purchased a Lenovo notebook some years ago and that had Windows 8. I was familiar with the features of that OS and life was good. One day suddenly I get a pop-up for an upgrade and I happily go for it. Guess what? My laptop got updated to Windows 10 and I was very happy. However, all of a sudden I had a very fancy looking screen and everything I saw seemed entirely different. I could manoeuvre through some apps but I got overwhelmed when it came to different settings. After a few days, I came across this book by Mathew Sanderson on Windows 10 and heaved a sigh of relief. The latest version of Windows is explained with pictures in a very concise and systematic manner. It’s a small book and it doesn’t bore with other techie stuff. So, if you feel stuck or lost with Windows, I’d suggest you buy this book.

title: Windows 10: The Beginner's Guide on how to enjoy and make the most of Windows 10
summary: Basic outline of the new MS OS Windows 10
review: Eh, Basic outline of the new MS OS Windows 10, give a brief overview of the OS, some key features, etc. Very, very basic. No detail info or troubleshooting or anything ver specific. Glad it was free, wasn't worth the .99c

title: CompTIA Security+ SYO-301 Study Guide

title: Window 10: Personal Guide to Microsoft Window 10 - Operating System, User Interface, Computer, and Technology
summary: A new OS with sophisticated features.
review: According to this book, there is a lot of sophisticated features that have been installed in this latest version of Windows. Cortana, a feature of Windows 10 seems very intriguing to me. It enables a voice interface in accessing files and applications. I have been using Windows 7 for more than 2 years now and I think it is right time for me to try out this enhanced features of Windows 10. If I have not gotten this book, I would have not realized that my current OS is actually upgradable to windows 10. I prefer now to upgrade first my OS instead of buying a new PC or laptop that has Windows 10 installed in it.

title: Window 10: Personal Guide to Microsoft Window 10 - Operating System, User Interface, Computer, and Technology
review:
There are more typos in this short book then I've seen in any full-length book I've ever read. Most of these are easy enough to figure out, but a few were a bit confusing.

This book totally ignored the major privacy issues Microsoft built into Windows 10.

title: Window 10: Personal Guide to Microsoft Window 10 - Operating System, User Interface, Computer, and Technology
summary: Not so much a brief description than a guide
review: I didn't get any useful information just a description of what you could do......and what was updated from win 8 & win 7 in win 10 are many yet only mentions a few ..I would not recommended

title: Hacking: Tapping into the Matrix Tips, Secrets, steps, hints, and hidden traps to hacking: Hacker, Computer, Programming, Security & Encryption
review:
Non-hackers should read this and get themselves ready for attacks like those mentioned here.

I am not a hacker nor am I a wannabe hacker! I wasn’t a person who used the internet or computers excessively, but recently due to my new business work I need to get more acquainted with them. And that included the cons as well. Buying this book (not exactly this but something with the same topic) was my husband’s idea so that I would get a more in-detail idea of the ‘matrix’ these days. I am glad I did purchase this book, because it made me realize about the many weaknesses within a computer and network.

The basics as well as more advance stuff are included here and also it was really easy to understand what they are about. There were links included to some of the software sites, and this was really convenient for me. I just checked some of them out to get a better idea of the software. Personally for me, I think the file search software could be quite useful (I am horrible at organization). Before I didn’t think much of viruses, Trojan horses, worms, dns and some I haven’t even heard of etc.
Of course at the end, I had trouble getting a clear idea of all those codes, zips, dns etc. This would actually help me to protect myself against hacking.

title: Hacking: Tapping into the Matrix Tips, Secrets, steps, hints, and hidden traps to hacking: Hacker, Computer, Programming, Security & Encryption
summary: From the hackers' point of view
review: I was looking for a hacking book to learn more about a system's loopholes and to get more information on how to make my sites and systems more secured. This book, surprisingly, has provided me specifics and steps hackers use to exploit security weaknesses and different computer programs. The steps pretty straightforward and clear. This information can be used to plug in the holes and find weak areas in my system. Also made me aware of possible attacks from outside and how they can be prevented. It pays to invest in anti-malware and virus programs but it is also one thing to learn the basics of these attacks to better fight them. If you are into hacking, there surely are a lot of knowledge for you in this book. But this would be a good read for anyone who would like to fend off attackers as well.

title: Hacking: Tapping into the Matrix Tips, Secrets, steps, hints, and hidden traps to hacking: Hacker, Computer, Programming, Security & Encryption
review: Very impressive and interesting to read. This book is very informative and well written. It's packed with useful information about different types of hacking. A great guide for beginners because it has step by step guide on how to execute each tip and every detail are discussed really well.

title: Big Marketing Ideas for Small Marketing Budgets: Online Strategies for Getting More Local Business FAST
summary: Local Business Marketing on a Budget
review: Local businesses can be overwhelmed with all of the information out there on how to market their business. Big Marketing Ideas for Small Marketing Budgets is a great place to start. Follow the steps in this book and you will be getting a great foundation for your online marketing.

title: Dating Women - Cybernetics: How to Attract ANY Woman You Want
review: Not really a lot of "advice." Not written very well. It rambles from thought to thought. I hate to give a negative review, but I can't imagine this book really helping anyone.

title: How To Play a Death Knight In WoW: Your Step-By-Step Guide To Playing Death Knights In WoW
review: The book begins with a mistake- says that DKs start at level 40. They start at 55. It also states the level when you choose your spec line, incorrectly. At best, its a poor rehash of hover tool tips you can get off the screen when you play. Its completely useless. There is more in the WoW DK forums that is correct and useful than in this "book".

title: How To Play Rift: Your Step-By-Step Guide To Playing Rift
review:
That's giving this too much credit. This book is a rewrite of a not very good guide to WOW. Not much of it actually applies to RIFT, and what does is only very basic.

There is a whole chapter on crating Cornwizner, the Worgen Warrior. To bad there is no worgen race in Rift.
Another chapter talks of the best way to gather cloth for first aid. Again this is not applicable to rift.
There is very little information in this POC at all. And what is there only applies to Rift in a very generic fashion.
I took one for the team buying this.
This is bad enough that I think this company should be banned from Amazon!
